Original Sample: The sun was unrelenting as Scott's car rushed along a desolate highway in the southern Idaho desert. They were headed to Vegas to celebrate Lydia's 21st birthday tomorrow and the quicker they got there, the quicker the drunken debrauchery could begin. Lydia slid over the leather seats in Scott's 69' Camero and laid her head on his shoulder while he wrapped his arm around her and pulled her in closer. Lydia smiled, this was their first cross country trip together and while sitting in a cramped space for days on end would lead to constant bickering and fighting for most people in that type of situation, this trip had only brought them closer. Life was good as she fell asleep in his arms.   Lydia awoke with a start. They were stopped. In the gloom of the twilight of the setting sun, Scott's headlights illuminated an orange detour sign straight ahead right in the middle of the road. An arrow on the sign pointed left to a little road that transversed the interstate. That's odd Lydia thought. They had mapped their route to Vegas before they left and had made certain to check for road closures and detours along the way. Although the department of National Traffic and Road Closure had no detours or closures listed on their site, here they were staring a detour sign in the face. And what an odd looking detour sign it was. It was n't the electronic signs that were commonly used that Lydia was used to seeing or even one of the bright orange standard signs that are sometimes used. No, this sign was severely weathered with cracks and dents all over it. The orange color had faded into a sort of sickly yellow and the'Detour' word was off somehow. A little to widely spaced and'new' looking to be on a sign this old.  Looks like we have to take this side road and go on a little detour  Scott said,  but look, there's little gas station right before the road curves around that hill. We can stop there and fill up on gas since I'm nearly out.   I have a bad feeling about this,  Lydia said  We've researched this so much. How could there be a road closing on a major interstate that we did n't know about?   I do n't know , Scott replied  maybe they'll know more at the gas station once we get there . Scott turned the car down the side road toward the gas station as Lydia took out her phone,  I'll bring up our location on mapquest to see if I can find the quickest route around the detour that'll bring us back to the interstate.  As they headed the short distance to the gas station and as Lydia waited for Google Maps to calculate their location, she gazed listlessly out the window into the darkening Nevada night and that's when she noticed it, the yellow reflective glare of dozens of pairs of eyes staring back at her. Cyotes she thought.....except, most of these eyes seemed to be 6 or 7 feet high....strange. Scott pulled his Camero into the gas station and they stepped out into the fading sun. Lydia checked back to see if the eyes were still there but they had disappeared. As they walked up to the gas station, Lydia realized how dilapidated this shack really was. Most of the windows were broken, the roof was rusted and seemed to be caving in at places. Dead tumble weeds were pilled chest high against the weathered exterior of the shack, surely this place is abandoned Lydia thought. She was just about to open her mouth to tell Scott they should turn around when a little girl walked out the front of the store. She could n't have been older than three or four years old wearing a strawberry print red dress and two adorable pigtails in her platinum blond hair.  Little girl, what are you doing here? Are your parent's inside ? Lydia called out. The little girl turned to her and smiled, then, out of nowhere, she came running at Lydia full speed and screaming like a demon out of hell. Lydia was frozen with shock and disbelief as the little girl launched herself at Lydia's head using a round house kick to propel her off the ground and came flying at Lydias' face with teeth bared. Lydia snapped out of her trance just in time to knock the girl aside and go running back to the car.  GET IN  she screamed at Scott as he seemed to snap out of his own dumbfounded trance. Scott jumped in and started up the car but before they could speed away, a morbidly obese woman flew out of the gas station faster than she should have been able to yelling,  You stupid, worthless, imbecile nut gobbler! How DARE you touch my child!  before smiling and coyly stating,  oh but you'll pay....they'll make sure that you pay.   What the fuck did she just say?  Lydia stated in shock.  Scott turn the fuck around back the way we came, I'm calling the police, something is definitely wrong here . As Lydia picked up her phone to dial, she noticed that Google Maps had finally pinpointed their location and instead of being on a road somewhere in the desert, they were just in the middle of a desert. This road was nowhere on the map! As they neared the interstate they had just left, Lydia noticed a reflective pair of eyes near the side of the road and something gleaming in the middle of the road.  STOP  Lydia screamed and Scott brought the car to a screeching halt. There, right in the middle of the road, someone had laid out spike strips. Scott gave her a look of utter terror as he eased the car around the strips then continued, more cautiously, towards the interstate. Once on the interstate, the detour sign that pointed them down that dastardly road had disappeared. Lydia had already posted their ordeal to all of her social networking sites, the local and national news outlets and contacted the local police by web and phone on the drive out and now she was contacting AAA to send someone out to meet them for gas. They stopped every car that passed that they could to warn them about heading down that road and some of the passing cars stopped to chat and see how things would play out. It took maybe 30 minutes for the police to respond, and a local journalist came to the scene as well. Scott and Lydia gave their police report, AAA filled their car with gas and as there was nothing else for them to do, they headed to Vegas.   The sheriff and the journalist who showed up and went to investigate things were never seen again. Once the FBI got involved in the investigation, they turned up a clan of hundreds of mutant cannibals who had been living in the area, secretly, for years. They estimate hundreds may have fallen victim to this clan before they got to Scott and Lydia who acted rationally.
